com.stormpath.sdk.oauth

Interface ResourceRequestAuthenticator


  • public interface ResourceRequestAuthenticator
    Authenticates a client request to an API resource (URI) endpoint based on the presence of an OAuth Access Token in the request. This interface reflects the Builder design pattern to allow customization of how the authentication attempt is processed. For example: 
     AuthenticationResult result = Application.authenticateAccount(AuthenticationRequest)
 application.authenticateOauthRequest(httpRequest)}
   .inLocation(RequestLocation.HEADER, RequestLocation.BODY)
   .execute();
    Since:
    1.0.RC
    See Also:
    Application.authenticateAccount(AuthenticationRequest), authenticate(HttpRequest)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OAuthAuthenticationResult authenticate(HttpRequest httpRequest)
      Authenticates an OAuth-based HTTP request using a bearer Access Token and returns the corresponding result.
      ResourceRequestAuthenticator inLocation(RequestLocation... locations)
      Specifies the location(s) where the OAuth bearer access_token will be checked.

    • Method Detail

      • inLocation

        ResourceRequestAuthenticator inLocation(RequestLocation... locations)
        Specifies the location(s) where the OAuth bearer access_token will be checked. Once found, the token will be used to authenticate the OAuth request. Unless configured via this method, the default locations that will be checked are the RequestLocation.HEADER and RequestLocation.BODY. See RequestLocation for more information.
        Parameters:
        locations - the location(s) where the OAuth bearer access_token will be checked.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        See Also:
        RequestLocation

      • authenticate

        OAuthAuthenticationResult authenticate(HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Authenticates an OAuth-based HTTP request using a bearer Access Token and returns the corresponding result. The result type may be either a OAuthAuthenticationResult or a AccessTokenResult if the client authenticated with your server-side API specifically for the purpose of obtaining a new OAuth Access Token. For the latter case, you can extract the OAuth response as a JSON expression, like shown in the example below: 
              AccessTokenResult result = (AccessTokenResult) Applications.oauthRequestAuthenticator(application).authenticate(HTTP_REQUEST_TO_AUNTHENTICATE)
      String oauthAuthenticationResult = result.getTokenResponse().toJson()
        Throws a ResourceException if the request cannot be authenticated.
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - either a javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest instance (if your app runs in a Servlet container) or a manually-constructed HttpRequest instance if it does not. An argument not of either type will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        the result of the authentication attempt.
